title: Needlecraft Monthly Meet-Up
description:
Calling all fans of knitting, crochet, cross-stitch, sewing, and embroidery!

This virtual meet-up is a chance for beginning and experienced UCSF crafters to come together and work on their projects in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We hang, we chat, we work on fabulous projects, and share advice and inspiration. Join us!

Register below to receive the Zoom link and password. See all upcoming Needlecraft Meet-Ups to save your seat today!

All Makers Lab pop-ups are open to the UCSF community. If you are a DPH employee, UCSF alum or retiree, please contact the Makers Lab to register for this pop-up.

Photo from meetup host and UCSF staff member Ariel

Have questions about the Makers Lab? Visit the Makers Lab webpage or contact us. The Makers Lab is open by appointment for UCSF teaching, learning, and research projects. Contact the Makers Lab to schedule an appointment.

title: A Slower Introduction to R: Session 1: Do math
description:
About the series

This session is the first in a 7-session learning series on R, A Slower Introduction to R. The series is designed for UCSF researchers who intend to begin using R in their research. The series is intended to be a (relatively) slow-paced introduction to R. It does not assume any prior exposure to R or computer programming.

The series has been designed to help learners approach common data-related tasks, and will draw on data examples from the health sciences (including public health and medicine). 

Each session (scheduled for 1.5 hours, but we may finish earlier on occasion) will involve short mini lectures, interspersed with hands-on exercises.

Registration for each session is required, using a UCSF account.

We are likely to follow this introductory-level series with intermediate-level sessions (tentatively in Spring 2025).

About the session

Each session is titled in the form of a "How can I..." question. This first session is titled "How can I do math?" and will cover: 

  • RStudio's panes
  • the RStudio console
  • mathematical operators
  • mathematical functions
  • object assignment

Please install R and RStudio prior to attendance. Instructions will be sent out via email prior to the session. 

Please watch the orientation video prior to attendance. A link will be sent out via email prior to the session.

About the instructor

The instructor, Yea-Hung Chen, PhD, MS, has roughly 10 years of experience teaching R to the UCSF community. He designed and taught UCSF's first-ever R course (Biostat 213) and taught the introductory biostatistics course for UCSF's MS in Global Health program (GHS 207). 

Disability statement

Slides will be available on the Course Learning Environment at least 24 hours prior to each session. Learners are welcome to use recording or closed-captioning features embedded in the Zoom platform.
